sn36.22:2.1: 3 The Explanation of the Hundred and Eight
sn36.22:3.1: 22 The Explanation of the Hundred and Eight
sn36.22:4.1: “Mendicants, I will teach you an explanation of the teaching on the hundred and eight.
sn36.22:4.3: And what is the explanation of the teaching on the hundred and eight?
sn36.22:4.4: “Mendicants, in one explanation I’ve spoken of two feelings. In another explanation I’ve spoken of three feelings, or five, six, eighteen, thirty-six, or a hundred and eight feelings.
sn36.22:5.1: And what are the two feelings?
sn36.22:5.3: These are called the two feelings.
sn36.22:5.4: And what are the three feelings?
sn36.22:5.7: And what are the five feelings?
sn36.22:5.8: The faculties of pleasure, pain, happiness, sadness, and equanimity. …
sn36.22:5.10: And what are the six feelings?
sn36.22:5.11: Feeling born of eye contact … ear contact … nose contact … tongue contact … body contact …
sn36.22:5.14: And what are the eighteen feelings?
sn36.22:5.15: Six kinds of lingering that give rise to happiness, six that give rise to sadness, and six that give rise to equanimity. …
sn36.22:5.17: And what are the thirty-six feelings?
sn36.22:5.18: Six kinds of lay happiness and six kinds of renunciate happiness. Six kinds of lay sadness and six kinds of renunciate sadness. Six kinds of lay equanimity and six kinds of renunciate equanimity. …
sn36.22:5.20: And what are the hundred and eight feelings?
sn36.22:5.21: Thirty six feelings in the past, future, and present.
sn36.22:5.22: These are called the hundred and eight feelings.
sn36.22:5.23: This is the explanation of the teaching on the hundred and eight.”
